result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

JOSHUA P. JOHNSON appeared by video means with Attorney.  Testimony taken.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed.  Defendant bound over for trial.  Bond Continues. records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 11:45 AM Defendant JOSHUA P. JOHNSON in court with attorney Emma K Blankschein (both video from WCJ) & attorney Ben Szilagyi (in person).  Defendant JOSHUA P. JOHNSON in custody.  Eric Sparr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JOSHUA P. JOHNSON appeared by video means with Attorney.  This case was set for Prelim today.  Defense is requesting the Prelim be adjourned 1 to 2 weeks and waive time limts.  The State doesn't object.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Bond Continues.  Record closed @ 11:48.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Email from Atty Blankschein: Mr. Johnson is scheduled for a PH on Monday @ 1145- we are not planning to proceed with the preliminary hearing that day.  Therefore, we're requesting to cancel transport and have Mr. Johnson appear by video from the jail.
